description: Transform the toolkit website into a comprehensive educational resource with auto-sync from the ai-toolkit repo, covering agents, skills, scaffolds, MCP, automations, and more.

userStories.title: Cross-repo build trigger
userStories.description: As a toolkit maintainer, I want the website to automatically rebuild when I push to the ai-toolkit repo, so the documentation is always current.
acceptanceCriteria: GitHub Action in ai-toolkit repo triggers repository_dispatch to toolkit-website repo on push to main
Website repo has workflow that responds to repository_dispatch event
Trigger includes commit SHA for traceability
userStories.notes: Website workflow updated to accept repository_dispatch. Template workflow for ai-toolkit created at docs/setup/ai-toolkit-trigger-workflow.yml

userStories.title: Build-time data extraction
userStories.description: As a developer, I need the build process to clone the ai-toolkit repo and extract structured data from all agents, skills, scaffolds, and templates.
acceptanceCriteria: Build script clones ai-toolkit repo (or uses GitHub API)
Parses all agent markdown files, extracts: name, description, category, full content
Parses all skill markdown files, extracts: name, description, triggers, full content
userStories.notes: Created scripts/extract-toolkit-data.ts that reads from local toolkit (~/.config/opencode), parses frontmatter, categorizes agents, and generates manifest. Counts: 57 agents (4 primary, 53 subagents), 26 skills (16 regular + 10 meta), 3 scaffolds.

userStories.title: Landing page redesign
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want the landing page to immediately convey what agentic AI development is and why it matters, so I'm motivated to learn more.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero communicates the core value proposition clearly
What is this? section explains agentic AI for newcomers
Visual overview shows how the pieces connect (agents → skills → projects)
Stats/counts are pulled from generated manifest (not hardcoded)
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.notes: Hero updated to accept counts as props. page.tsx imports manifest and passes dynamic data. Stats show 57 agents, 26 skills, 4 primary agents. Verified in browser - works in both light and dark mode.
userStories.e2eScope: Landing page renders correctly with dynamic data from manifest

userStories.title: Concepts section - The Big Picture
userStories.description: As someone new to the toolkit, I want a conceptual overview that explains how all the pieces fit together, so I understand the mental model before diving into specifics.
acceptanceCriteria: /concepts page with overview of the system architecture
Explains: agents, skills, scaffolds, templates, project.json, PRDs, multi-session coordination
Visual diagrams showing relationships between concepts
Written for technical people who may not write code
Links to detailed pages for each concept
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.notes: Created /concepts page with architecture diagram showing layered system (You → Primary Agents → Sub-Agents → Skills/Project Context). Includes explanatory text and links to 6 concept sub-pages. Updated Header to show site navigation on non-home pages. Verified in browser, works in light/dark mode.
userStories.e2eScope: Concepts overview page renders with diagrams and links to sub-pages

userStories.title: Concepts - Understanding Agents
userStories.description: As a learner, I want to understand what agents are, how they work, and how they communicate with each other.
acceptanceCriteria: Covers: primary vs sub-agents, how agents are invoked, agent communication via files
Explains the delegation pattern (builder → ralph → critics)
Shows real examples from the toolkit
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.notes: Created /concepts/agents page explaining primary vs sub-agents, invocation methods, delegation pattern, and agent communication. Shows real data from manifest. Verified in browser, works in light/dark mode.
userStories.e2eScope: Agents concept page renders with examples and explanations

userStories.title: Concepts - Understanding Skills
userStories.description: As a learner, I want to understand what skills are and how they differ from agents.
acceptanceCriteria: Covers: skills vs agents, when skills are loaded, skill triggers
Explains meta-skills that generate project-specific skills
Shows real examples from the toolkit
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.notes: Created /concepts/skills page explaining skills vs agents, trigger phrases, meta-skills, and how skills are loaded. Shows all regular skills (16) and meta-skills (10) from manifest. Verified in browser, works in light/dark mode.
userStories.e2eScope: Skills concept page renders with examples and explanations

userStories.title: Concepts - Project Setup
userStories.description: As a learner, I want to understand how projects are configured for the agent system.
acceptanceCriteria: Covers: project.json structure, docs/ directory layout, conventions
Explains: PRD registry, session locks, quality gates
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.notes: Created /concepts/projects page explaining docs/ directory structure, project.json configuration, CONVENTIONS.md, PRDs, and session locks. Shows annotated examples. Verified in browser, works in light/dark mode.
userStories.e2eScope: Projects concept page renders with annotated examples

userStories.title: Concepts - The Workflow Loop
userStories.description: As a learner, I want to understand the typical development workflow with agents.
acceptanceCriteria: Covers: PRD creation → story implementation → review → testing → commit
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.notes: Created /concepts/workflow page with visual flowchart showing the 6-step build-review-ship loop. Covers PRD creation, story review, implementation, quality gates, code review, and shipping. Includes section on multi-session coordination with session locks. Verified in browser, works in light/dark mode.
userStories.e2eScope: Workflow concept page renders with flowchart

userStories.title: Agent reference index page
userStories.description: As a user, I want to browse all available agents in a searchable, categorized list.
acceptanceCriteria: /agents page listing all agents from the manifest
Agents grouped by category (Primary, Critics, Developers, Testers, etc.)
Each agent shows: name, short description, category badge
Click through to individual agent pages
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.notes: Created /agents page with search, category filter dropdown, primary-only toggle, and grouped display. Shows 57 agents with category badges (Critics, Developers, Testers, Other). Links to individual agent detail pages. Verified in browser, works in light/dark mode.
userStories.e2eScope: Agents index page renders with categories, search works, links to detail pages

userStories.title: Individual agent detail pages
userStories.description: As a user, I want to read the full documentation for any agent, rendered as rich content.
acceptanceCriteria: Full agent markdown content rendered as rich HTML (not code block)
Proper heading hierarchy, code syntax highlighting, lists, tables
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.notes: Created /agents/[slug] dynamic pages with react-markdown for rich HTML rendering. Shows agent name, category badge, primary badge if applicable, description, full content, and related agents from same category. Breadcrumb navigation back to agents index. Verified in browser, works in light/dark mode.
userStories.e2eScope: Agent detail pages render markdown as rich HTML with proper formatting

userStories.title: Skills reference index page
userStories.description: As a user, I want to browse all available skills in a searchable list.
acceptanceCriteria: /skills page listing all skills from the manifest
Skills grouped by type (Core skills vs Meta-skills)
Each skill shows: name, description, trigger phrases
Click through to individual skill pages
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.notes: Created /skills page with search (including triggers), type filter dropdown, and grouped display. Shows 26 skills (16 core + 10 meta) with trigger badges. Links to individual skill detail pages. Verified in browser, works in light/dark mode.
userStories.e2eScope: Skills index page renders with categories, search works, links to detail pages

userStories.title: Individual skill detail pages
userStories.description: As a user, I want to read the full documentation for any skill, rendered as rich content.
acceptanceCriteria: Full skill markdown content rendered as rich HTML (not code block)
Proper heading hierarchy, code syntax highlighting, lists, tables
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.notes: Created /skills/[slug] dynamic pages with react-markdown for rich HTML rendering. Shows skill name, type badge (Skill/Meta-Skill), description, trigger phrases, full content, and related skills. Tables and code blocks render properly. Verified in browser, works in light/dark mode.
userStories.e2eScope: Skill detail pages render markdown as rich HTML with proper formatting

userStories.title: Scaffolds reference page
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see available project scaffolds and what stack they provide.
acceptanceCriteria: Each scaffold shows: name, description, included stack (languages, frameworks, etc.)
Links to scaffold source on GitHub
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.notes: Created /scaffolds page showing all 3 scaffolds (Go Chi Postgres, Nextjs Prisma, Nextjs Supabase) with stack badges, included features list, 'Best for' section, GitHub source links, and 'Creating Your Own Scaffold' guide. Verified in browser, works in light/dark mode.
userStories.e2eScope: Scaffolds page renders with scaffold cards and GitHub links

userStories.title: Getting started guide
userStories.description: As a new user, I want a clear step-by-step guide to set up and start using the toolkit.
acceptanceCriteria: Links to relevant concept pages for deeper understanding
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.notes: Created /getting-started page with prerequisites, 4-step setup guide (install toolkit, bootstrap project, create PRD, start building), project structure diagram, key workflows grid, and Learn More links. Verified in browser, works in light/dark mode.
userStories.e2eScope: Getting started page renders with code snippets and navigation links

userStories.title: Site navigation
userStories.description: As a user, I want consistent navigation so I can easily move between sections.
acceptanceCriteria: Header navigation with dropdowns for Concepts, Agents, Skills, etc.
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.notes: Updated Header component with dropdown menus for Concepts and Reference sections. Created Footer component with quick links organized by category. Created Breadcrumbs component for auto-generating navigation from pathname. Updated root layout to include Header and Footer globally. Removed inline headers/footers from all interior pages (concepts/*, agents/*, skills/*, scaffolds) and replaced manual breadcrumbs with Breadcrumbs component. Typecheck passes, lint passes, verified in browser, works in light/dark mode.
userStories.e2eScope: Navigation works on desktop and mobile, breadcrumbs display correctly

userStories.title: Search functionality
userStories.description: As a user, I want to search across all content to find what I need quickly.
acceptanceCriteria: Searches agent names, skill names, and page content
Results show relevant matches with context snippets
Keyboard shortcut to open search (Cmd+K / Ctrl+K)
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.notes: Implemented SearchModal component with Cmd+K/Ctrl+K keyboard shortcut, search input in header, searches agents/skills/scaffolds/pages, results grouped by type with context snippets, keyboard navigation, dark mode support
userStories.e2eScope: Search opens with keyboard shortcut, returns relevant results, navigates to pages

userStories.title: MCP Server documentation
userStories.description: As a user, I want to understand the MCP server component and how to set it up for semantic code search.
acceptanceCriteria: /mcp page explaining what the MCP server is
Covers: what MCP (Model Context Protocol) is, available tools (code_search)
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.notes: Implemented /mcp page with MCP overview, server types (local/remote), configuration examples, popular servers (Playwright, Context7, GitHub), OAuth authentication guide, usage examples, and troubleshooting. Added to navigation and search.
userStories.e2eScope: MCP page renders with setup instructions and code examples

userStories.title: Automations documentation
userStories.description: As a user, I want to understand the GitHub Actions automations I can add to my repos.
acceptanceCriteria: Documents: triage (CI failure analysis), prd (PRD generation), release-notes
Each automation shows: purpose, how to add to your repo, configuration options
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.notes: Implemented /automations page with 5 automations: CI Triage, PRD Generator, Release Notes, Code Review, Documentation Sync. Each has purpose, triggers, features, and example YAML. Added to navigation and search.
userStories.e2eScope: Automations page renders with YAML examples and configuration details

userStories.title: Agent templates documentation
userStories.description: As a user, I want to understand how agent templates work and how to create project-specific agents.
acceptanceCriteria: Lists available templates by category (backend, frontend, testing, etc.)
Explains: when to use templates, how project-specific agents are generated
Shows example of template → generated agent transformation
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.notes: Implemented /agent-templates page with 6 template categories (backend, critics, frontend, infra, styling, testing), Handlebars variable reference, template-to-agent transformation example. Added to Header Reference dropdown, Footer links, and SearchModal. Typecheck passes, lint passes.
userStories.e2eScope: Agent templates page renders with category list and transformation examples

userStories.title: Changelog / Recent updates
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see recent changes to the toolkit so I know what's new.
acceptanceCriteria: Pulls recent commits from ai-toolkit repo (last 20-30)
Groups by date, shows commit message and affected files summary
Highlights significant changes (new agents, new skills)
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.notes: Implemented /changelog page with 30 recent commits grouped by date (Feb 20 and Feb 19). Shows change type badges (feat/fix/refactor/docs), scope badges, and summary stats. Includes legend, links to GitHub commits/releases, and auto-update notice. Added to Header nav, Footer links, and SearchModal. Note: Currently uses static data - US-021 will add git commit extraction at build time.
userStories.e2eScope: Changelog page renders with commit history grouped by date

userStories.title: Update data extraction for new content types
userStories.description: As a developer, I need the build process to also extract MCP, automations, agent-templates, and git history data.
acceptanceCriteria: Extracts MCP README and tool definitions
Extracts automation markdown files (triage.md, prd.md, etc.)
Fetches recent git commits for changelog
All new data included in toolkit-manifest.json
userStories.notes: Updated extract-toolkit-data.ts to extract: 14 agent templates (across 5 categories: backend, critics, frontend, styling, testing), git changelog (50 recent commits parsed into conventional commit format). Added types for AgentTemplate, ChangelogEntry, ChangelogDay. Manifest now includes agentTemplates, templateCategories, and changelog arrays. Changelog page now reads from manifest instead of static data. Note: MCP and Automations pages use static content as they document concepts rather than extracted data.
